intro: Gymnocoronis sessilis, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are basal, sessile, and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and yellow. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
